channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: These nations were models of Covid-19 success. Not anymore
item.description: The United States has been widely criticized for its approach to the coronavirus pandemic, and the lack of strict nationwide measures to contain the outbreak is reflected in the highest number of cases and deaths in the world.

item.title: CNN's Don Lemon: Trump is being beaten by the coronavirus
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon gives his take on President Donald Trump announcement that there will not be Republican convention activities in Jacksonville, Florida.

item.title: Chinese fugitive taken into custody as US claims Houston consulate was a part of espionage network
Why did China choose the Chengdu consulate to retaliate?
item.description: China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has ordered the closure of the US consulate in Chengdu days after the US forced the Chinese consulate in Houston to cease operations. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

item.title: What's behind Trump's retreat
Covid-19 vaccine probably won't be 'widely available' until several months into 2021, Fauci says
item.description: As the US hit a sobering 4 million cases of Covid-19 and the rising daily rate of confirmed cases and hospitalizations suggest the virus is far from under control, medical experts are urging political leaders to shut down the country and start over to contain the pandemic.

item.title: France and Germany will test visitors from high-risk countries, including the US
The 32 most bizarre lines from Trump's latest interview with Sean Hannity
item.description: President Donald Trump appears to have developed a new Thursday night ritual: He calls in to Fox News anchor Sean Hannity's show and just, well chats.

item.title: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped in a Covid-19 treatment center
item.description: A 14-year-old girl has allegedly been raped in a Covid-19 treatment center in India, police said.

item.title: Spain's king distances himself from his father amid allegations of $100M transfer from ex-Saudi monarch
item.description: Even as Spain battles the coronavirus, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez says there's another issue that "all Spaniards are witnessing" -- the "unsettling reports" about the murky finances of the royal family.

item.title: Boris Johnson's dream of a 'Global Britain' is turning into a nightmare
What the heck is going on in Portland?
Ocasio-Cortez accuses Yoho and Texas congressman of lying about tense exchange
Harry and Meghan sue over 'intrusive' pictures of son Archie
item.description: Harry and Meghan, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, are suing over paparazzi photographs of their toddler son, Archie, their lawyer said in a statement.

item.title: Goldman Sachs agrees to a $3.9 billion 1MDB settlement with Malaysia
item.description: Goldman Sachs has agreed to a $3.9 billion deal with the Malaysian government to settle claims relating to the bank's role in the huge corruption scandal at 1Malaysia Development Berhad, the sovereign wealth fund.

item.title: Trump erupted over Esper's de facto ban on Confederate flag, sources say
item.description: President Donald Trump erupted late last week after Defense Secretary Mark Esper issued a new military-wide directive that was a de facto ban on the display of the Confederate flag.

item.title: 'No proof,' Official defends Sweden's Covid-19 move as mortality numbers soar
item.description: Sweden's State Epidemiologist Anders Tegnell tells CNN's Christiane Amanpour that, despite the country's high mortality rate, the no-lockdown strategy has "served us very well."

item.title: Former professor who resigned after US campus uproar found dead
item.description: Mike Adams, the former University of North Carolina Wilmington professor who angered the campus community on Twitter, was found dead in his home Thursday afternoon, according to the New Hanover County Sheriff's Office.

item.title: A Nollywood film about two women in love faces an uphill battle in a country where homophobia is rampant
item.description: Two women lay in bed in a tight embrace, one is stroking the other's hair and whispers that she is in love with her.

item.title: An Australian food company is finally renaming its racially offensive cheese brand
item.description: An Australian dairy company is rebranding a controversial line of cheese products that share a name with a racial slur, in an attempt to "eliminate racism" from its brand.

item.title: Bill Gates has a message to Covid-19 conspiracy theorists
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates responds to the many conspiracy theories and widespread falsehoods online about him and the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Taylor Swift's stirring surprise indie album earns rave reviews from critics and fans
item.description: Taylor Swift has been on quite a journey in recent years -- going goth on "Reputation," pivoting to loved-up sugary pop on "Lover," and finding her political voice in between -- but her newest, toned-down offering, "Folklore," may be resonating with critics and fans more than any of her releases to date.

item.title: Scientists think they've finally figured out where chickens come from
item.description: The first chicken to ever cross the road was likely in Southeast Asia, new research has revealed.

item.title: Here's what's in the Republican's stimulus proposal
item.description: CNN's Manu Raju reports on what is in the GOP stimulus proposal and what President Trump was not able to include in the plan.

item.title: Covid-19 can be a prolonged illness, even for young adults, CDC report says
item.description: Covid-19 can be a prolonged illness, even among young adults without underlying chronic medical conditions, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Friday. Thirty-five percent of those surveyed by the agency said they still weren't back to their usual good health even two to three weeks after testing positive for the disease.

item.title: They lost their mom and dad to coronavirus -- 15 days apart
item.description: Two young brothers from Houston said goodbye to their mother at the beginning of July, not knowing their father would also die 15 days later and for the same reason.

item.title: Emirates will cover medical expenses if passengers catch Covid-19
item.description: Emirates airline, the United Arab Emirates flag carrier, has become the world's first airline to offer to cover customers' medical expenses and quarantine costs should they contract Covid-19 during their trip.

item.title: Tips for surviving a financial crisis, from a woman who lost almost everything
item.description: In 2008, Karen Schultz-Tarnopol's life was a "10 out of 10." She was a wholesale account manager at Washington Mutual, she had a mortgage on a house in Michigan, and two kids who played hockey. She traveled. She felt like she could afford anything she needed.

item.title: Crowd saves two children from burning building
item.description: The two siblings, aged three and ten, escaped a fire that broke out, according to CNN affiliate BFMTV.

item.title: Award-winning writer who was detained on island for 6 years offered refugee status by New Zealand
item.description: An award-winning Kurdish-Iranian journalist who was detained for six years in an offshore Australian immigration center has been formally granted refugee status in New Zealand.

item.title: Diverse smallpox strains were widespread in the Viking Age, new study reveals
item.description: Smallpox, the only human infectious disease to have been successfully eradicated, ailed people at least 1,000 years earlier than previously thought.

item.title: He battled Covid-19 for 128 days. Here's what he wants you to know
item.description: "Miracle" Larry Kelly recovered from being infected with coronavirus. He spoke to CNN's Brianna Keilar about his experience after 128 days of hospitalization.

item.title: Alex Zanardi transferred to ICU, just days after moving to specialist rehab center
item.description: Ex-Formula One driver and Paralympic champion Alex Zanardi has been transferred to intensive care just days after he was moved to a specialist neuro-rehabilitation center.

item.title: Cruise fans explain why they can't wait to cruise again
item.description: Christine Beehler was on a two-week cruise voyage around South America when Covid-19 caught up with her ship.

item.title: 'Top Gun: Maverick' release date pushed to summer 2021
item.description: Those feeling the need for speed are going to have to wait until next summer to see "Top Gun: Maverick."

item.title: See inside Turkey's Hagia Sophia
item.description: The Hagia Sophia will hold Friday prayers for the first time in more than 80 years after Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan ordered its conversion into a mosque. A Turkish court annulled the 1934 presidential decree which made it a museum. CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

item.title: Michelle Obama-approved designer Duro Olowu's pursuit of the 'culture of style'
item.description: Ever since Nigerian-born British fashion designer Duro Olowu launched his eponymous label in 2004, his aesthetic has remained remarkably consistent. Known for his use of color and pattern, Olowu also favors the sharply tailored silhouettes of his multicultural 1970s upbringing, including fitted jackets, precision-cut wide-leg trousers, billowing capes and kimonos, and intricately cut yet liberating dresses with hemlines below the knee -- all rendered in vivid and unusually juxtaposed fabrics, patterns, and textures.

item.title: Ancient Roman artifacts found in seafood store
item.description: During a routine inspection in a seafood store, authorities in Spain discovered 13 Roman amphorae that could date back to the first century.

item.title: Twenty years on after soccer's most controversial transfer
item.description: The noise inside the Camp Nou on November 23, 2002, was unlike any other experienced in Barcelona's soup bowl of a stadium.

item.title: Elderly laundromat owners go viral modeling customer's forgotten clothes
item.description: Two geriatric laundromat owners have become Taiwan's latest viral sensation by posing for a series of photos wearing clothes left behind by their customers.

item.title: The all-female crew sailing the world to study plastic pollution
item.description: Emily Penn has studied marine plastic pollution for years. Then she discovered the issue may disproportionately affect women, so she put together an all-female crew to research the problem.

item.title: National Tequila Day 2020: Drink in some surprising facts
item.description: It's National Tequila Day in the United States. And if there's ever a year in which we deserve a shot or two, 2020 is it.

item.title: What's behind Trump's retreat
item.description: It took a surge of nearly two million coronavirus cases over the last month — and the spate of devastating polls that ensued — for President Donald Trump to finally begin acknowledging reality.

item.title: Trump's briefings are becoming increasingly absurd
Chinese fugitive taken into custody as US claims Houston consulate was a part of espionage network
item.description: • Analysis: Risk of missteps rises as US and China force consulates to close • Why did China choose to close Chengdu?

item.title: Boris Johnson's dream of a 'Global Britain' is turning into a nightmare
Strongest storm on the planet moves toward Hawaii
item.description: Major Hurricane Douglas is the strongest storm on the planet right now and it's approaching Hawaii. The storm is a category 4 hurricane, packing dangerous winds of 130 mph that extend 30 miles from the center of the storm. A major hurricane is any storm ranked category 3 -- winds 111 to 129 mph -- or stronger.

item.title: US again accuses Russia of sending arms and mercenaries to Libya
item.description: The US military has again accused Russia of sending weapons, including anti-aircraft missiles, to Libya and sending Russian mercenaries to operate on the front lines of the conflict there.

item.title: Video shows US fighter jet fly terrifyingly close to Iranian passenger plane
item.description: CNN's Sam Kiley explains renewed tensions between Iran and the US after a US fighter jet did a fly by inspection of an Iranian passenger plane.
